label: 観音
本: The Clear Mirror:  A Chronicle of Japanese Court During the Kamakura Period, (1185-1333) . Stanford University Press . 1998
説明文: In Buddhism, the bodhisattva of sompassion, who assumes innumerable forms in order to save different types of sentient beings and to respond to different situations. Some of the best-known manifestations are: Thousand-Armed Kannon, Nyoirin Kannon (shown with the wheel of the Law), Eleven-Headed Kannon, Horse-Headed Kannon (the horse tramples evil), Shōkannon (saves hungry spirits), and Fukūkensaku Kannon (carries a fish hook to catch gods and men in the sea of illusions and land them on the shore of enlightenment). Jundei Kannon (Chapter 15) is a three-eyed from. See the Lotus Sutra, Chapter 25, for a description of the many benefits conferred by this major cult figure. [菩薩　如来観音　聖観音　不空羂索観音　准胝観音]
